alert.note: Alert for Clark (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 14 at 9:40AM CST until December 14 at 6:00PM CST by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Wintry Mix Continues Today with Snow Tonight... A wintry mix continues in north-central Wisconsin this morning with another round of heavier snow increasingly likely overnight tonight. Snowfall rates could exceed 1 to 2 inches per hour for a time tonight. Expect difficult to hazardous travel. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 8 inches. For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Clark County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, from 6 PM this evening to 9 AM CST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
